  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling northbound on Route 183 in Goliad, Texas when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 5649 gallons of gasoline was released. Clean Harbors responded to the scene and continues to remediate the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024050466
item.description:
Report E-2024050466

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LHO experienced a UN3077 Omnirad OMBB release from a 1100-pound supersack. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 pounds of product released to a 20' x 0.5' area of the wood trailer and concrete dock floor due to a tear caused by improper loading. The material was transferred form the damaged supersack into a new one for shipment on. The released product and damaged sack were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050416
item.description:
Report E-2024050416

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN1457 were damaged due to unknown reasons and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 5-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050534
item.description:
Report E-2024050534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents, and damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, the damaged cardboard was containerized into one (1) 5-gallon drum.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2024, at 1105 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Kilgore, Texas regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Muriatic acid (Hydrochloric acid solution, UN1789, 8, II). The release was reportedly due to a load shift and was contained to the trailer floor. Contractors cleaned up the release was absorbents, neutralizer and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon metal drums and one (1) 95-gallon metal drum. All waste generated was staged onsite pending the shipper's disposition and pending disposal.
